The place is clean.  The food is good.
Iâ€™ve never sat down to eat here but they have really good duck here. They donâ€™t really know English but the food is mad good
Nice place for family dinner. The tables are not tightly packed like other Chinese restaurant. The food is good but not 5 star good but good enough. Service is bit slow but they were very nice.
Itâ€™s great old school food. If youâ€™re looking for atmosphere then youâ€™re not asking the right questions

Celebrated my great aunt's birthday banquet here. We took up about half of the restaurant. They were able to section it off for us. The food was fantastic, authentic Cantonese style. Come try them out.

Our server was extremely attentive. Most dishes were excellent. Only one we didnâ€™t love so we asked them to exchange for another which he accommodated with no fuss at allâ€¦ replacement dish was awesome.

å¿…é¡»æ‹¼æ¡Œï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬ä¸¤ä¸ªäººï¼Œè¿›æ¥çš„æ—¶å€™æœ‰è‡³å°‘ä¸€åŠçš„æ¡Œå­ç©ºç€ä¹Ÿå¿…é¡»æ‹¼æ¡Œï¼Œè·Ÿä¸è®¤è¯†çš„äººä¸€æ¡ŒçœŸçš„å¾ˆå°´å°¬ã€‚å°±é¤çš„æ—¶å€™ï¼Œä¸œè¥¿éƒ½æ²¡åƒå®ŒæœåŠ¡å‘˜ç›´æ¥å°±ç»™æˆ‘ç«¯èµ°äº†ï¼Œæ— è¯­ã€‚æœ€åè¿˜å¥½æ„æ€è¦æ›´å¤šå°è´¹ï¼Œå¥½å¤§çš„è„¸ã€‚
foods and services are excellents.
Great place for dim sum, lunch and dinner

You can tell it's legit by the significant number of mature/older Chinese American folks visiting on Sunday. The place was very busy, but offered very speedy service and customer throughput. I recommend it.
It was good and very affordable. The dim sum was fresh with good variety.
å¥½å¥½å¥½
Bad attitude asking for tip for a bad service

I paid $11 and specifically asked for only meat, but they barely gave me any. The portion was disappointing for the price. On top of that, the staff was rude â€” especially the person who took my order. I felt like I was treated differently because I donâ€™t speak Cantonese( I only speak mandarin), which was really upsetting. I know they probably donâ€™t care about reviews, but Iâ€™m sharing this so others know what to expect before going.

Ridiculous cashiers by the take out area. Food is more expensive compared to local  restaurants or take outs. Being humiliated, literally laughed at me by the two cashiers when asked about price being much higher than local restaurants. Upfront told the cashiers won't ever come back again!!

it wasnâ€™t a great experience at all. food was far below expectations.  had best dimsum elsewhere i frequent in the last 20 years in chinatown manhattan

dimsum was cold ..2:45 pm.. bland
This was hand down the best pecking duck I have had in New York so far!! My man Paul really made the meal awesome and recommend some amazing these I wouldâ€™ve passed on!! RUN donâ€™t WALK!

Extravagant & remarkable ğŸ¥‡ğŸ¥‡

Invited to partake in a fanciful dinner for 8 inside a vip room. The venue itself exudes a bit of grandiosity as you walk past chandeliers & exquisite murals.

This is a popular spot for dim sum on weekends but also a favorite for dinner celebrations.

Our Caymus 2015 vintage from Napa Valley exploded us with delight after it was decanted for 30 minutes.

PROS
1) dazzlingly entrees
2) upscale dining in vip rooms available
3) fresh ingredients & high quality
4) BYOB
5) very accommodating in all aspects

CONS
1) the staff could have checked on our needs more often

Best dim sum in NYC. Food flavour+quality for value is unmatched.

Itâ€™s not catered to people who donâ€™t speak Canto/Mando. Not easily accessible because there isnâ€™t much English spoken here, so brush up on that dim sum etiquette before you come here so you know how to order, how to pay, how to refill ur tea, etc.

Bamboo Garden is a classic and affordable no frills cart dim sum spot that satisfies all your dim sum cravings. It can get busy on weekends and the line system can be a bit confusing if you donâ€™t speak Mandarin, but the wait is worth it when you get seated and can immediately start selecting dishes off the carts. Favorite dishes were the shrimp stuffed eggplant, fried dough rice noodle rolls, fried tofu and shrimp rolls, egg tarts - plus we ordered pan fried noodles and honey walnut prawns off the menu.

This is by far my favorite Dim Sum Restaurant in NYC. Even when packed we rarely wait long if at all. Because of the quick turnover the food is always hot and fresh, especially at the busiest of times. My wife and I considered having our wedding here and still talk about how awesome it wouldâ€™ve been.

The BBQ place at the front door is giving uncooked food , i was buying BBq squid and some roast pig all cost for $25 ,after I purchase then I canâ€™t wait to eat at the counter because I was hungry at that time , as soon I try the BBq squid it taste undercook and I let them know and they did change for a new one ,The taller men wearing glasses at the front is always so mean and donâ€™t even apologize for anything just act like Iâ€™m wrong , thatâ€™s not all , after I leave and take a walk and went back home As soon I bite on the BBq squid they are undercook again, I had to go back to ask for a full refund this time for things I buy, how canâ€™t you sell undercook BBq for customers, as soon I had back the same person that sell me the BBq are refuse to give me the full refund for the mistake they make , how can they staying business like this ways ,I will never think people should trust this place , They only give me the squid refund to me ,I was ask for full refund of $25 for what I purchase , I had to bring back second time with all items I canâ€™t even eat no more , for there mistakes, thatâ€™s not fare and unfriendly service,The men at the front wearing glasses always had a mean face when you are buying with him ( I wish they know what they doing as a big dim sum place around for the locals, we can call the health department for undercook BBQ meat , I donâ€™t know what his name is ,I will never give this place a chance no more .( not because the money, they donâ€™t worth it, I canâ€™t eat nothing they sell no more , I left the roast pig at counter for them that I paid , they treat customers this way for 2 times mistakes in same day !
came here for dimsum and food was pretty good.

Terrible customer service. The numerous one-star reviews about their awful service speak alot about this restaurant. A business that fails to provide quality service doesnâ€™t deserve returning customers. The fact that so many people have complained about their poor customer serviceâ€”and that it remains just as bad during my visitâ€”shows a clear lack of leadership, proper training, and willingness to improve based on customer feedback.

I placed a delivery order with this restaurant, but due to an unavailable item and their inability to cancel it, I initially decided to cancel the entire order. However, I later changed my mind and chose to keep it. While contacting the delivery appâ€™s customer service, I also tried calling the restaurant to clarify the situation. Unfortunately, the woman who answered the phone was extremely rude and unprofessional.

She repeatedly interrupted me, spoke over me, and refused to let me finish my sentences. I have never encountered such poor customer service at a restaurant before. I typically donâ€™t leave reviews, but this experience was so terrible that I felt compelled to share. Iâ€™ve dined here before, but after this incident, I have no desire to return. No customer should be treated this way, and I sincerely hope the front desk staff member who answered my call reconsiders how she speaks to customers. To make matters worse, she hung up on me saying â€œIm done talking to you bye.â€ I sincerely do not recommend this place.
Um, what, yumso !

Really liked the Cantonese duck but beef chow fun was only ok. Would go back for dim sum. Thought the prices were reasonable for the large portions, $55 for two people

More variety than other dimsum place i went to down the block but that could just be because of timing(10am ish).

I didnâ€™t like the beef tripe it was too firm and not tended enough. The sesame balls were good it had mung bean filling instead of red bean. Cute and dainty.

Dimsum cart ladies are coming frequently and the space is just enough where they can come to you fairly quickly. The tables turn fast but they dont rush you. However, when you pay please prepare to go as the next group will be all up your space as servers collect table cloth for next group.

Bathroom is small but sink is cool, no paper towels for hand drying instead its a hand dryer.

The meats were flavorful and I like the pepper garnish that also doubles as a lil snack to pick up on:)
Very nice place, great food, the Pekin duck was very tasty! Congrats!
The service is bad, the food is so-so, if there are less than two people don't go in, they don't have a table for you, they make you sit at a table with strangers.
Pretty good dim sum place. I just wish they didn't stop serving sweet dishes at 2.

What a joke!!! Either increase your prices or stop calling your appetizers as entree.

Do not mislead.

I went there towards the end of dim sum and it was very quiet there. We did have dim sum and as usual, it was delicious.
Staff were very attentive to me and my friend.

Great for dim sum.
Very yummy and had cute pig custard buns.
The best things was the custard pineapple bun and the pork ribs! Other dishes were good too. Very busy,Â lots of food.

However WARNING TO ALL PEOPLE ALLERGIC TO SHRIMP THE PEARL MEATBALL (meatball with red/white rice on top) HAS SHRIMP
Good dim sum and good service in Brooklyn! Lots of selections!
Restaurante con muy buena comida para ir con familia y amigos

The food was extremely disappointing, with most dishes lacking any flavor. The egg rolls were still frozen inside, and the beef and chicken dishes were mostly bones with very little meat. We didnâ€™t end up eating most of the food. Even the fortune cookies were stale. Honestly, even a small takeout spot would have been far better than this. I wonâ€™t be returning.

About 3.5 stars across the board. Place gets crowded due to Fei Long market shoppers across the street. People eat and then do their shopping. Not many small tables so there is a lot of table sharing for smaller parties of 2 to 3 people. The BBQ section has really good roast meats.
The best Dim Sum in Brooklyn. It took a while to get a table but the wait was worth it. Food was fantastic.

Went here for a wedding this past weekend. The food was DELICIOUS! Oh man, I think I'm still full. The servers were incredibly attentive, and since it was my 1st time at a Chinese restaurant like this, they took the time to explain each food to me. I was greatly appreciative of that.
å‰é¢ç‡’è‡˜é»å¿ƒå§æœ‰å€‹ç”·çš„æ…‹åº¦å¾ˆå·®ï¼Œæ¯æ¬¡å»éƒ½é»‘å£é»‘è‡‰ï¼Œä»Šå¤©å¤šæ”¶äº†æˆ‘éŒ¢é‚„èªªæˆ‘å°‘çµ¦äº†
Tried to add a party surcharge of 40$ for bringing in a birthday cake.

This is our regular Dim Sum spot. Best to go early in the day to avoid the crowds. If you head there for weekend at 11am-2pm expect it to be very crowded. The dishes are very good. But if you go during busy times it can be stressful.

Cart service âœ… Banquet-style dining room âœ… All the hits are legit: cha siu (roast pig), haw gao, shu mai âœ… Reasonable prices âœ… Would skip the crispy pork and cha siu bao next time.  Service is about average for a big, loud, and busy Chinese restaurant.

Pretty mediocre place. Its a pretty crowded restaurant however the wait time isn't super long. The food itself didnt meet the price and it wasn't fresh and it was cold. Very expensive for just four people.
Really stressful since the tables are ordered in such a way that you need to stand up to each cart to pick your food. Waiters do not speak English which was really annoying for us since we don't speak Chinese. Roasted duck was awesome tho

I'm not a big fan of these banquet halls because they tend to have mediocre food but bamboo garden was quite good. I was a little surprised, everything was cooked just right, nothing was overcooked or undercooked. Even the crispy duck baoâ€¦

Visited with family for dimsum during a weekend morning so there was a bit of wait for seats. But the turnover seemed pretty fast as we didn't have to wait too long. The feng zhao was decent, the flavor wasn't as strong and as spicy as other ones I've had. We also had the shrimp cheong fun, ha mai cheong fun, dim sum, har gao, lava custard buns, mini egg tarts and chrysanthemum jelly. The desserts were my favorite. We didn't try anything else but it does look like they offer peking duck and buns as we saw another table order it.

By the entrance, roast meats are sold. It also looked like a lot of people can place lunch box orders there as there was a guy who placed an order for 40 lunch boxes as I was leaving.
A great spot for dimsum in Brooklyn Chinatown! It has the traditional cart service with standard favorites, along with some fun innovative buns (piggy custard bun, walnut buns, sesame mochi buns)!

Huge family style plates of seafood. Come during the day time for dimsum. They also have multiple private rooms with ktv in the basement that you can book for parties. There is a minimum charge for the rooms though

We came here for dim sum. The food was alright. It was not amazing but it was not terrible either. Some of the foods were cold when we ate it and it did not taste good as it should. We were quickly seated and did not have to wait. Theâ€¦

Last night, I placed the order for takeout. The foods were great but the forks they provided itâ€™s disgusting. It looks like it had been used, attached the picture I took. We ended up using our own forks. It makes me think that if my food were clean??? Luckily non of us had any reaction after the meal.
My new favorite DIM SUM spot, so many delious dishes, they take it too a higher level and friendly service we will be back soon, interesting area to try and shop for Asian Foods.
Pretty good, went for dim sum, food is excellent but carts could roll around more quickly

If I can add a video I would. Went here for lunch and was treated nice by the ladies behind the take out glass as well as the register. My cousin who is receiving chemo at the office across the street wanted some to take home so I went back. I got there and got yelled at by an older man who must be the owner or management because I wanted to use Apple Pay. He as well as the male cashier lied and said they donâ€™t accept Apple Pay even though I bought lunch there two hours earlier with guess what?? APPLE PAY! I showed them the transaction on my phone and my receipt. Not using Apple Pay is fine but donâ€™t lie to my face. Itâ€™s condescending and rude and he was yelling for no reason.  The yelling man said no Apple Pay so I said sure Iâ€™ll come back with my card. I came right back with my card and then he said $20 minimum. If you didnâ€™t want to serve me just say that. I couldnâ€™t make this up. I guess heâ€™s not used to women telling him not to yell at them. Left in disgust and disbelief. As a non Asian and Iâ€™ll even say as a black woman donâ€™t even waste your time here. You will get yelled at and talked about.

Great place in brooklyn. I tried squid for the first time and was pleased. Also I Enjoyed their fried rice with gravy. Service was great. Also the clanging of the crystal chandeliers gave the place a calm vibe. Great place for families, groups or couples.

Really like this place !!! Ordered takeout from here during the weekends when they serve dim sum. Their roasted duck is so delicious, very fresh!! Whenever my friends come visit, I will bring them here.
Excellent dishes from salty chicken to seafood! Highly recommended for celebrating birthdays, graduations, banquets, or special occasions.
åœ°æ–¹å¯¬æ•æ˜äº®.é£Ÿç‰©åƒ¹å»‰ç¾å‘³.ç‚¹å¿ƒå¾ˆæœ‰ç‰¹è‰².äººå¤šéœ€è¦æ‹¼æ±æ¯”è¼ƒæ¬ èˆ’é©.
The service here is pretty good compared to other restaurants. The food is a little pricer than usual but the food is great.

Usually you need to pre order these bad boys. I came here for family dinner. I decided to order the king crab to treat my family. I randomly asked if they got a big one and they said we got a 10.75 pound monster just casually.. Needless toâ€¦

My most recent visit with frinds: Got here close to the end of the dim sum service, but they were still giving good service! They were willing to warm up dishes for us and helped us figure out what could be replaced since they ran out of some stuff at the end of the day. The food was still good too!

I come here a lot with family and usually find the food to be great! Service is same as above. We enjoy our experience here every time

Newly renovated dim sum restuarant. My to go dim sum spot in the area. I have visited nearby resturants but I just keep coming back to Bamboo Garden. Dim sum is fresh, presentable, and small dimsum is $2.50. Alot of tables that canâ€¦
I always come here for the holidays! The food is just right.

Fantastic Chinese food. Daughter and I had the Fried Rice/chicken dish/ Eggplant dish/ Wonton Soup of their origin/ and 4 Shrimp Dumplings that were to die for. Kind of high priced but well worth the money. Highly recommended! Went 4/25/24
We were at a Chinese wedding at this place. So I had a traditional Chinese dishes at this place. They were amazing
Very good service very good food very good atmosphere dim sum was very delicious

The service is not the best when you order takeout dim-sum or any takeout service.  The ladies and gentlemen behind the counter are all rude.  You talk to them nicely and they donâ€™t acknowledge you at all.  But once you get loud and start yelling, then they want to take your order.  I guess itâ€™s the typical Chinese culture for them.  Anyway, besides that they have some very good and authentic Chinese dim sum and rice, and noodle dishes.  Their roast duck, garlic, and soy sauce chicken is also very good.  My family and I used to go there a lot for yumcha.  But lately, we just do takeout.  Still very good, but kind of pricey for dimsum, but hey, weâ€™re having an inflation in the U.S. so everything went up!  Though their service and attitudes definitely needs improvement! ğŸ¥ŸğŸ²ğŸš
